newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: FORECAST-VENDEX H1 NET SEEN UP 25 PCT.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-VENDEX H1 NET SEEN UP 25 PCT.

text.p: First half profits at Dutch retail and services group Vendex International are set to rise by a healthy 25 percent, analysts said, driven largely by impressive growth in the temporary employment sector.

Analysts forecast net profit in the six months ending July, due on Tuesday, of 98 to 125 million guilders, versus 88 million a year ago. The consensus estimate is 109.9 million. Estimates exclude changes in the value of fixed assets and securities.
"Most of the growth will come from temporary employment," said MeesPierson analyst Jurgen Veenker, adding the Dutch market performed particularly well.

"(Temporary employment) is where the main growth is in Vendex's results at the moment, where the market is really expanding," he said. The sector accounts for around 15 percent of total operating profit.
And with legal changes in the Netherlands, Germany, Belgium and Spain, facilitating the use of temp workers, this growth is set to continue.
"The structural component (of the temporary employment market) will be stronger than in the past. There will still be cyclical downturns, but they won't be as strong," Veenker said.
Department stores, which account for around eight percent of operating profit, will continue to recover, analysts said, as the group's renovation and modernisation programme continues.
"We expect good results from department stores...with the reorganisation there and the fact it's less concentrated on clothing than some rivals," Generale Bank's Ab Barneveld said.
Food retailing, which accounts for around 20 percent of operating profit, will show a mixed picture as losses in the Belgian market diminish, analysts said.
The contribution from real estate, which has been a moneyspinner for the group recently, is typically hard to estimate. Some analysts put it at around 40 million guilders, others slightly lower.
